first-greeting.speaker: Nerissa
first-greeting.text: Oh—!@ A new face in my shop?@ Welcome, traveler.@ Careful not to knock anything over—some of these pieces are older than tides themselves.

options.text: I'll be careful. Do you sell all of this yourself?
Depends—what's worth buying here?
I wasn't planning to buy… just to look.

intro1.speaker: Nerissa
intro1.text: Everything you see drifted down from somewhere—lost, forgotten, waiting for another story.@ I just give them a place to rest for a while.@ Are you looking for something particular?

options.text: Something shiny, maybe. Got anything rare?
Something that reminds me of the surface.
Maybe I already found what I was looking for.

fluster1.speaker: Nerissa
fluster1.text: Just looking?@ Hah… I suppose I can't complain.@ A merchant's shop isn't much without an audience to admire her wares.

options.text: Or admire the merchant herself.
Then I'll make sure to look carefully.

fluster2.speaker: Nerissa
fluster2.text: You're going to ruin my professional image with talk like that.@ I'm supposed to charm my customers, not the other way around.

options.text: Guess I'm just good at haggling for attention.
Then consider this my first successful trade.

collector1.speaker: Nerissa
collector1.text: Rarity's a funny thing.@ Some buy jewels, others buy stories.@ Me? I like the pieces that shine because they've survived.

options.text: You see the beauty in broken things.
Sounds like you've got a soft spot for survivors.
That's a poetic way to run a shop.

soft1.speaker: Nerissa
soft1.text: Maybe I do.@ Even shattered shells can still catch the light.@ You just have to look from the right angle.

options.text: You talk about treasures like they're people.
I think that's what makes you special.

fluster3.speaker: Nerissa
fluster3.text: Wh-what? You can't say things like that while I'm trying to sound mysterious!@ You'll make me forget my prices!

options.text: Then I'll take that as a discount.
Maybe I like seeing you flustered more than your wares.

bond1.speaker: Nerissa
bond1.text: You really are strange.@ Most customers just ask for a price list.@ You… make it feel like a story instead.

options.text: Every good deal needs a little adventure.
Maybe I just wanted to learn yours.

bond2.speaker: Nerissa
bond2.text: You've got a way with words.@ Keep that up and I might start giving away secrets instead of trinkets.

options.text: I'd rather earn them.
Maybe I already have.

driftglass-hint.speaker: Nerissa
driftglass-hint.text: Hehe… you know, there's one thing I always keep behind the counter.@ Not for sale.

options.text: Oh? Something valuable?
Something sentimental, maybe?

driftglass-hint2.speaker: Nerissa
driftglass-hint2.text: It's just driftglass.@ Broken bottles smoothed by time and tide.@ They catch light so softly it feels like holding a memory.

driftglass-hint2.speaker: Nerissa
driftglass-hint2.text: I like to think even sharp things can become gentle, if given enough patience.@ Maybe that's why I keep them.

driftglass-hint2.speaker: Nerissa
driftglass-hint2.text: If you ever find any…@ bring them here, okay?@ I'll make it worth your while.

moonjellycandy-hint.speaker: Nerissa
moonjellycandy-hint.text: Hah… have you ever heard of moon jelly candy?@ It sometimes drifts down from the surface, glowing like little lanterns.

options.text: Candy? Underwater?
Sounds sweet and beautiful. Like you.

moonjellycandy-hint2.speaker: Nerissa
moonjellycandy-hint2.text: You're… far too smooth.@ But yes, it's real.@ It glows softly in the dark—sweet, but fragile.

moonjellycandy-hint2.speaker: Nerissa
moonjellycandy-hint2.text: I suppose I have a weakness for it.@ Something about it reminds me of how fleeting warmth can be.

moonjellycandy-hint2.speaker: Nerissa
moonjellycandy-hint2.text: If you ever come across any, bring it by.@ Maybe we'll share a piece.

ending.speaker: Nerissa
ending.text: Take care out there, traveler.@ And remember—every current brings something lost, and someone found.@ Maybe next time, it'll be both of us.
